de: Wanderung in Marseille in den Hügeln von La Barasse. La Croix bietet einen Panoramablick auf Marseille und das Huveaune-Tal.
en: Hiking in Marseille in the hills of La Barasse. La Croix offers a panoramic view of Marseille and the Huveaune valley.
it: Escursione a Marsiglia sulle colline di La Barasse. La Croix offre una vista panoramica su Marsiglia e sulla valle di Huveaune.
fr: Randonnée à Marseille dans les collines de la Barasse. La Croix offre une vue panoramique sur Marseille et la vallée de l'Huveaune.
nl: Wandelen in Marseille in de heuvels van La Barasse. La Croix biedt een panoramisch uitzicht op Marseille en de vallei van Huveaune.
es: Senderismo en Marsella en las colinas de La Barasse. La Croix ofrece una vista panorámica de Marsella y del valle de Huveaune.

en:
1. If you are arriving by car, park at the Domaine Départemental de la Barasse car park. Go down towards the houses until you reach Rue Pic Foch. Turn left. Follow the blue markings. Rue Pic Foch turns once to the right, once to the left, and once to the left again. Continue straight on. Do not follow Rue Pic Foch. At the next crossroads, turn right onto Montée de l'Olivier which becomes Chemin de la Maque.
2. At the crossroads with Rue du Vallon Chauméry, turn left. 50m further on, take the gate to the left of the Domaine de la Forbine park. Take a wide track up the hillside and stay on it for 800m.
3. After about 200m, leave this track for a stony path on your left which passes under the high voltage lines. This is a pleasant path through holm oaks, rockroses, laurels, heathers and arbutus.
4. After 1 km of walking you reach the cross of St Marcel. From this point you have a view of the Huveaune valley. Retrace your steps and follow the path to the old fence of the Domaine de la Forbine
5. Leave the Domaine de la Forbine through an opening in the fence. Follow the path which - before the rocky bar - turns right. Follow the blue markings. Before you reach the Col de Galvaudan, you have an exceptional view of the city of Marseille and the Côte Bleue.
6. At the pass, the path arrives on a DFCI track (tank n° 444). Go down immediately to the Vallon de la Vigie on your right. The path will now be marked in yellow. This path descends through a landscape of heather, a flower in late October/early November.
7. Walk down the path until a track crosses. Cross the track and continue along the path opposite. 
After a few metres on this path you are in front of the Etoile mountain range. You can see the village of Allauch with its church Notre Dame du château and the aire de la Mourre. This rocky plateau, at the foot of the Baou Trauqua mountain, is used as a target for the training of forest fire-fighting planes, hence the red colour.
8. After 200m leave this wide path before a right turn, going down a path that follows the bottom of the Vigie valley. Follow the yellow markings. This is a pleasant route through an undergrowth of kermes oaks, holm oaks, ash trees and pines, a vegetation that has invaded the old restanques. When you reach the first houses, follow the path that runs along the fences of the houses.
9. When you reach a road (Boulevard de la Forbine), go down it. Pass the Trúc Lâm pagoda. Leave this road (near a car park and a cistern n° 407) to take the path on the right which crosses again the park of the Domaine de la Forbine.
10. You are on the way back. A little further on, there is a beautiful view of the old enclosure of the Forbine and the oppidum of Baou de St Marcel. Continue on your way to the Vallon de Chauméry car park. Take the Chemin de la Maque and a few metres further on you are back at the Barasse car park.

de: Eine leichte Wanderung, bei der Sie einen von der menschlichen Aktivität geprägten Raum entdecken können: Täler, die früher auf Restanques bewirtschaftet wurden, das Tal des Huveaune, dieses dichte Band, das Marseille mit seinem Hinterland verbindet. Ein Ausflug, der vor allem im Herbst zu empfehlen ist, wenn die Heide blüht und die Erdbeerbäume gleichzeitig Blüten und Früchte tragen.
en: An easy hike which allows you to discover an area impregnated by human activity: valleys formerly cultivated in restanques, the Huveaune valley, this dense strip linking Marseille to its hinterland. An escapade to be recommended, especially in autumn when the heather blossoms and the arbutus trees bear flowers and fruit at the same time.
it: Un'escursione facile che permette di scoprire un territorio impregnato dall'attività umana: valli anticamente coltivate a restanques, la valle di Huveaune, questa fitta striscia che collega Marsiglia al suo entroterra. Una fuga da consigliare, soprattutto in autunno, quando l'erica fiorisce e i corbezzoli producono fiori e frutti allo stesso tempo.
fr: Une randonnée facile qui permet de découvrir un espace imprégné par l'activité humaine : des vallons jadis cultivés en restanques, la vallée de l'Huveaune, cette bande dense liant Marseille à son arrière-pays. Une escapade à conseiller notamment en automne quand les bruyères s'épanouissent et les arbousiers portent en même temps fleurs et fruits.
es: Una excursión fácil que permite descubrir una zona impregnada de actividad humana: valles antiguamente cultivados en restanques, el valle de Huveaune, esta densa franja que une Marsella con su interior. Una escapada recomendable, sobre todo en otoño, cuando el brezo florece y los madroños dan flores y frutos al mismo tiempo.
nl: Een gemakkelijke wandeling die u een gebied laat ontdekken dat doordrenkt is van menselijke activiteit: valleien waar vroeger restanques werden verbouwd, de vallei van de Huveaune, deze dichte strook die Marseille met zijn achterland verbindt. Een aanrader, vooral in de herfst wanneer de heide bloeit en de arbutusbomen tegelijkertijd bloemen en vruchten dragen.
